Escape to Canada  (2005)

In 2003, CanadaÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s reputation was going through a drastic transformation; the legalization of same-sex marriage and the decriminalization of marijuana, coupled with the influx of Iraqi war veterans and objectors, helped the nation shake its milquetoast reputation. Hosers no more, became known as a nation of smart, left-leaning hipsters. In Escape to Canada, filmmaker Albert Nerenberg (Stupidity) turns his smart, satirical eye on the emergence of Canada as a beacon of progressive politics, personal freedom and social justice.

Canada simultaneously legalized gay marriage and decriminalized marijuana, making the often derided country a sudden beacon of liberal cool. Montreal filmmaker Albert Nerenberg investigates his homeland's quick and tenuous ascent to the hip stratosphere. Variety calls Escape to Canada a "proud, benevolent, mischievous and altogether winning portrait of a country." 

Starring: Bono, George W. Bush
Director: Albert Nerenberg
